intro: Caralluma vansonii, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes, and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, succulent stems. Its flowers typically bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Caralluma vansonii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
